pullRequest.body:
Currently, some statements are available for `DifferentiableWithinAt` but not for `ContinuousWithinAt` or conversely (and the same for the other `WithinAt` notions), or they are both available with slightly different names or assumptions.

This PR is a first step to uniformize these API: I've gone through the APIs of the different notions, and added all the lemmas that were available for another notion to `ContinuousWithinAt` if they were missing here, and fixed some names. Once this PR is merged, I will open other PRs to make sure that all the other notions also have the same full API.

Notable changes (imported from lemma names of other notions, and that I found better than the `ContinuousWithinAt` version):
* rename `ContinuousWithinAt.insert_self` to `ContinuousWithinAt.insert` 
* rename `continuousWithinAt_congr_nhds` to `continuousWithinAt_congr_set`, and change its assumptions from `ùìù[s] x = ùìù[t] x` to `s =·∂†[ùìù x] t` (see Zulip discussion supporting this change at https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/local.20equality.20of.20sets/near/477653314)
* Added `continuousWithinAt_congr_set'` (taking an assumption `s =·∂†[ùìù[{y}·∂ú] x] t`)
* Added several variations around `ContinuousWithinAt.congr_of_mem` (both in their implication and iff version)
* Added `of_eq` versions of all the composition lemmas

Also, use `variable` in the `ContinuousOn` file.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

:v: sgouezel can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11590488211/job/32268164515)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11590488211/job/32268163700)
Just to be clear: this is not a uniformization change right? Is it just a better name or is there another reason I don't see?

Some lemmas using the assumption `t ‚àà ùìù[s] x` are named `..._mem`, others are named `..._mem_nhdsWithin`. The latter looks less ambiguous to me (as other lemmas with `of_mem` require that some point belongs to some set), so I chose to uniformize things a little bit.

```suggestion
  simp_rw [eventuallyEq_set] at h ‚ä¢ 
  simp_rw [‚Üê union_singleton, ‚Üê nhdsWithin_univ, ‚Üê compl_union_self {x},
    nhdsWithin_union, eventually_sup, nhdsWithin_singleton, 
    eventually_pure, union_singleton, mem_insert_iff, true_or, and_true]
  filter_upwards [nhdsWithin_compl_singleton_le x y h] with y using or_congr (Iff.rfl)
```

```suggestion
  (hg.mono_of_mem_nhdsWithin hs).comp hf (mapsTo_image f s)
```
Just for the sake of readability

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: uniformize `ContDiffWithinAt` API with other local notions
